title: Pregnant transgender man stars on cover of Glamour UK’s Pride issue
description: Glamour UK launched its digital June Pride cover this week featuring Logan Brown, a pregnant transgender man, as its cover star.

title: Over 100 people dead after catastrophic train derailment in India
description: A catastrophic train derailment in India has left over 100 people dead and hundreds more injured. NBC News’ Matt Bradley has the latest on the desperate search for survivors in the wreckage.

title: Bipartisan leaders invite Indian Prime Minister Modi to address Congress
description: The leaders of the House and Senate invited Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address a joint session of Congress during an official state visit on June 22.

title: El Salvador's Bukele pledges prison for white-collar criminals like the one for gangs
description: El Salvador’s President Nayib Bukele pledged to build a prison for white-collar criminals to fight corruption the way he has imprisoned suspected gang members.

title: Train crash in eastern India leaves hundreds dead or wounded
description: A passenger train derailed and collided with a goods train in Balasore in the eastern state of Odisha, according to accounts in Indian media. Early reports on casualties vary, but dozens are feared dead with hundreds more injured.

title: Paths to safety out of a troubled Sudan
description: On buses, on donkey carts and by boat, people in Sudan are fleeing intense fighting between warring military factions.

title: 45 bags of human remains found in western Mexico amid search for missing call center workers
description: Forty-five bags filled with human remains were found in the western Mexican state of Jalisco on Tuesday, officials said.

title: Elon Musk leaves China after whirlwind trip filled with praise and politics
description: World’s richest man Elon Musk was welcomed by top officials and hailed by citizens during his China visit, opposing “decoupling” amid China-U.S. tensions.

title: 45 bags containing human remains found in northern Mexico
description: Authorities in northern Mexico discovered 45 bags containing human remains in a gorge on the outskirts of Guadalajara but it is unclear how many bodies are there, police said. Seven people were reported missing from the region last week, but it’s unknown if they are among the remains.

title: How diplomatic tensions are making it hard for Americans to study in China
description: NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer explains how diplomatic tensions are making it harder for American college students to study in China. NYU Shanghai professor Marcel Daniels said not having as many Americans study in China is a “huge loss.”

title: Riots erupt after Senegalese political leader sentenced to jail
description: Riots broke out after a court sentenced leading Senegalese opposition politician, Ousmane Sonko, to two years in jail for corrupting youth. Sonko, who was widely expected to run in next year’s presidential election, was accused of raping a woman in 2021 and making death threats against her.

title: How the U.S.-China clash is being felt on campus
description: Few Americans are studying in China as the Covid-19 pandemic and diplomatic tensions between the two countries increasingly shut them off from each other.

title: China's Ukraine envoy urges countries to ‘stop sending weapons to the battlefield,’ negotiate peace
description: China’s Ukraine envoy appealed Friday to other governments to “stop sending weapons to the battlefield” and hold peace talks but gave no indication that his trip to the region made any progress toward a settlement.

title: Elon Musk meets Chinese officials in Shanghai
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk met the Communist Party Secretary Chen Jining to discuss business in Shanghai, official Chinese media reported. Musk praised the success of the Tesla-operated Gigafactory in Shanghai, adding that he is willing to deepen cooperation with various partners in the city.

title: World’s wheat supply at risk of a dangerous shock due to heat and drought, study warns
description: Extreme heat waves and drought due to climate change could shock the global supply of wheat and send prices soaring, according to a new study.

title: Newly discovered stone tools drag dawn of Greek archaeology back by a quarter-million years
description: Deep in an open coal mine in southern Greece, researchers have discovered the antiquities-rich country’s oldest archaeological site, which dates to 700,000 years ago and is associated with modern humans’ hominin ancestors.

title: U.S. to open northernmost diplomatic post in Norway; only mission above Arctic Circle
description: The United States will soon open a small diplomatic mission in Norway that will be its northernmost in the world and only such facility above the Arctic Circle, Secretary of State Antony Blinken announced Thursday.

title: Clashes in Senegal leave at least 9 dead; government bans use of social media platforms
description: Clashes between police and supporters of Senegalese opposition leader Ousmane Sonko left nine people dead, the government said Friday, with authorities issuing a blanket ban on the use of several social media platforms in the aftermath of the violence.

title: Japan demographic woes deepen as birth rate hits record low
description: Japan’s birth rate declined for the seventh consecutive year in 2022 to a record low, the health ministry said on Friday, underscoring the sense of crisis gripping the country as the population shrinks and ages rapidly.

title: QR codes boom in India
description: QR codes are booming in popularity in India, changing the game for food stalls and other vendors in how they can make money. NBC's Janis Mackey Frayer reports.
